title: SuperDuper 2.6.3 with Core Keygen
description:
Official Web Site: <a href=" http://www.shirt-pocket.com/SuperDuper/SuperDuperDescription.html" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://www.shirt-pocket.com/SuperDuper/SuperDuperDescription.html</a>

Have no fear. SuperDuper v2.6.3 is here, and it's compatible with Lion!

SuperDuper is the wildly acclaimed program that makes recovery painless, because it makes creating a fully bootable backup painless. Its incredibly clear, friendly interface is understandable, easy to use, and SuperDuper's built-in scheduler makes it trivial to back up automatically. 

It's the perfect complement to Time Machine under Leopard, Snow Leopard, and Lion, allowing you to store a bootable backup alongside your Time Machine volumeÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã¢â‚¬ï¿½and it runs beautifully on both Intel and Power PC Macs!

SuperDuper's interface confirms all your actions in simple, clear language to ensure that the end result is exactly what you intended. Take a look, and click for additional screen shots!

The SuperDuper!

We all know that using the Macintosh is usually a trouble-free experience.

Except when it's not. Like when:

* Your hard drive starts making that horrible clicking noise that signals an
  imminent meltdown

* A momentary lapse of coordination causes your MacBook Pro to take a
  dirt nap

* The system suddenly fails to boot

* Your most important day-to-day application isn't working with the
  system update you just applied

* The new driver you just updated is causing your Macintosh to crash

* That lousy software you just tried didn't come with an uninstaller, and
  scattered files all over your drive

* You need to restore a stable copy of your system, but don't want to lose
  what you've been working on

* You need to test new versions of the operating system with production
  data you can't afford to lose

It happens to all of us, eventually. And recovering can be a painful, error-prone, time-wasting experience, if it's even possible at all. Until now.


What new:

ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ Initial Mac OS X Lion support

ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ Scheduling usability improvements

ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ SuperDuper! can eject and unmount internal drives after copy

ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ Improved handling of target volumes that disappear during copy

ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ In-app support request now posts directly, rather than sending email

ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ Files that vanish between initial file copy and attribute update no longer
  cancel copy

ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ "Backup on connect" now works on 10.4 Tiger

ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ The During Copy progress bar updates properly for drives larger than
  1TB
ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ Very large nonstandard compressed files will copy without error

ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ Users will be warned when copying between volumes with different
  case-sensitivity

ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ Additional I/O error detection handling during copies

ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ Files with the user append flag set are properly removed without error

ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ Drive selection is maintained if the user clicks Cancel

ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ To simplify registration, SuperDuper! will swap the registration
  username and key if necessary

ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ Files with the same name but different case are properly removed when
  copying from a case insensitive to case sensitive volume

ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ Improved /Network exclusion logic upon error

ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ /DamagedFiles, /lost+found and /cores are now excluded during copy

ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ Sandboxing now shares App Store and Facetime

ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ Symantec Antivirus files now excluded during copy

ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ Mozy cache and log files are excluded during copy

ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ Dynamic link loader maps are not longer copied

ÃƒÂ¢Ã¢â€šÂ¬Ã‚Â¢ Upgraded 3rd party frameworks to latest revision (e.g. Growl SDK to
  1.2.1)
